column4: I installed a program (numpty physics) from a deb file and I cant uninstall it, sudo aptitude remove -f numptyphysics doesnt work
fuck you
Yeah, well i described it really well and you flame me
I installed a program (numpty physics) from a deb file and I cant uninstall it, sudo aptitude remove -f numptyphysics doesnt uninstall it
What does that command do?
I think you just got the name of the package wrong.
nope, it is correct
/usr/sbin/dpkg-reconfigure: numptyphysics is broken or not fully installed
or is it: "sudo apt-get install -f"  I can't remember
try "sudo apt-get install -f"
http://pastebin.com/d40a768f2
try installing the app completely: sudo aptitude install numptyphysics
Then remove it
It is odd that there error is that the icon cache file DOES exist
its not in the repo but I will install it
ok
You have a .deb package downloaded?  Is this correct?
yes
Unfortuantely I have to go now :(
thanks for the help

Sorry I couldn't help more! Good luck!  I suspect it's a poorly written package.  After you install and try to remove again I would try deleting that file that is creating the error. The font cache thingy
If it still didn't remove that is.
